summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from December 1, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes updates on election certification challenges, COVID-19 vaccine developments, various criminal investigations, and international affairs. The document serves as a daily intelligence summary for FBI leadership.

persons.name: Christopher Krebs
persons.context: Interviewed on '60 Minutes' defending election integrity and refuting fraud claims after being fired by President Trump.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in context of election legal challenges, firing of Christopher Krebs, and comments on Georgia election officials.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned as winning certified elections in multiple states and receiving first intelligence briefing.

persons.name: Kamala Harris
persons.context: Received first intelligence briefing alongside Joe Biden.

persons.name: Brian Kemp
persons.context: Criticized by President Trump for certifying election results and not overriding Secretary of State.

persons.name: Brad Raffensperger
persons.context: Defended election integrity against Trump's fraud claims and investigated third-party voter registration groups.

persons.name: Sidney Powell
persons.context: Filed lawsuit seeking to decertify Michigan election results on behalf of Trump allies.

persons.name: Gretchen Whitmer
persons.context: Target of kidnap plot and defendant in election lawsuit seeking to decertify results.

persons.name: Joel Hayden Schrimsher
persons.context: Sentenced for making online bomb threats against Federal Reserve building.

persons.name: Samantha Frances Brooks
persons.context: Charged with terrorist attack on train tracks in Washington state.

persons.name: Ellen Brennan Reiche
persons.context: Charged with terrorist attack on train tracks in Washington state.

persons.name: Michael Hari
persons.context: On trial for bombing a Minnesota mosque.

persons.name: Joe Morris
persons.context: Testified he sabotaged abortion clinic bombing plot in Illinois.

persons.name: Alexanda Kotey
persons.context: Accused ISIS 'Beatles' member on trial for terrorism charges.

persons.name: El Shafee Elsheikh
persons.context: Accused ISIS 'Beatles' member on trial for terrorism charges.

persons.name: Christopher Maier
persons.context: Resigned from Pentagon position amid post-election purge.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: Case recommended for dismissal by DOJ after receiving presidential pardon.

persons.name: Lev Parnas
persons.context: Pleaded not guilty to fraud and campaign finance charges; former Giuliani associate.

persons.name: Igor Fruman
persons.context: Pleaded not guilty to campaign finance charges; former Giuliani associate.

persons.name: Carter Page
persons.context: Alleged FBI agent used alias during 2017 interviews in lawsuit against FBI.

persons.name: Stephen Somma
persons.context: Allegedly used alias 'Steve Holt' during interviews with Carter Page.

persons.name: Samuel Little
persons.context: Confessed to killing 93 people; described as America's deadliest serial killer.

persons.name: Raymond Chan
persons.context: Charged with racketeering conspiracy and bribery in City Hall corruption probe.

persons.name: Jose Huizar
persons.context: Charged with running criminal enterprise shaking down developers.

persons.name: Harlan Kelly
persons.role: San Francisco Public Utilities Commission General Manager
persons.context: Charged with bribery for accepting gifts from contractor Walter Wong.

persons.name: Walter Wong
persons.context: Provided bribes to Harlan Kelly in exchange for insider information.

persons.name: Mohammed Nuru
persons.role: Former San Francisco Public Works Director
persons.context: Charged with fraud and lying to FBI in corruption scandal.

persons.name: Imaad Zuberi
persons.context: Pleaded guilty to campaign finance violations and exploiting political connections.

persons.name: Katherine Kealoha
persons.context: Sentenced to 13 years for conspiracy to frame her uncle.

persons.name: Louis Kealoha
persons.context: Spouse of Katherine Kealoha awaiting sentencing in corruption case.

persons.name: Scott Atlas
persons.context: Resigned from position after pushing herd immunity theory.

persons.name: Alex Azar
persons.context: Discussed COVID-19 vaccine distribution timeline and priority groups.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: Warned of 'surge upon surge' of COVID-19 cases after Thanksgiving.

persons.name: Stephane Bancel
persons.context: Announced emergency use authorization application for COVID-19 vaccine.

persons.name: Stephen Hoge
persons.context: Discussed vaccine approval and distribution timeline in interview.

persons.name: Andrew Cuomo
persons.context: Announced 'winter plan' for COVID-19 surge focusing on hospital capacity.

persons.name: Bill de Blasio
persons.context: Announced reopening of elementary schools and special education classes.

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.context: Planning trip to Middle East amid tensions after Iranian scientist assassination.

persons.name: Mohsen Fakhrizadeh
persons.context: Assassinated; Iran blamed Israel and vowed to continue nuclear program.

persons.name: Ali Shamkhani
persons.context: Accused Israel of using electronic devices to kill Fakhrizadeh.

persons.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
persons.context: Suspected of ordering Fakhrizadeh assassination to undermine Biden's Iran policy.

persons.name: Ajit Pai
persons.context: Announced resignation effective Inauguration Day.

connections.description: Trump fired Krebs as CISA Director after Krebs defended election integrity.
Trump publicly criticized Kemp for certifying Georgia election results and not overriding Secretary of State.
Trump pardoned Flynn, leading DOJ to recommend dismissal of his case.
Both former Giuliani associates pleaded not guilty to campaign finance charges.
Kelly accepted bribes from Wong in exchange for insider information on public contracts.

connections.context: Married couple involved in corruption conspiracy case in Hawaii.

connections.description: Kushner is Trump's son-in-law and senior adviser planning Middle East trip.
Powell filed election lawsuit on behalf of Trump allies seeking to decertify Michigan results.

events.title: Arizona and Wisconsin Certify Election Results
events.description: Arizona and Wisconsin certified presidential election results in favor of Joe Biden despite Trump campaign legal challenges.

events.title: Moderna Seeks FDA Emergency Authorization
events.description: Moderna applied for emergency use authorization for its COVID-19 vaccine after reporting 94% effectiveness.

events.title: Fakhrizadeh Assassination
events.description: Iranian nuclear scientist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh assassinated, with Iran blaming Israel and vowing revenge.

events.title: Scott Atlas Resigns
events.description: White House coronavirus adviser Scott Atlas formally resigned after pushing herd immunity theory.

events.title: FCC Chairman Announces Resignation
events.description: FCC Chairman Ajit Pai announced he will step down on Inauguration Day.

events.title: Supreme Court Hears Census Case
events.description: Supreme Court heard arguments on Trump's plan to exclude undocumented immigrants from census count for House apportionment.

events.title: Texas Man Sentenced for Bomb Threat
events.description: Joel Hayden Schrimsher sentenced to 2 years for threatening to bomb Federal Reserve building.

events.title: San Francisco Corruption Charges
events.description: San Francisco Public Utilities Commission General Manager Harlan Kelly charged with bribery in corruption probe.

keyFacts: Arizona and Wisconsin certified their presidential election results for Joe Biden on November 30, 2020, despite ongoing legal challenges from the Trump campaign.
Moderna applied for emergency use authorization for its COVID-19 vaccine, reporting 94% effectiveness, following Pfizer's similar application.
Iranian nuclear scientist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh was assassinated, with Iran blaming Israel and vowing both revenge and continuation of its nuclear program.
The Justice Department recommended dismissing Michael Flynn's case after President Trump granted him a full pardon.
FCC Chairman Ajit Pai announced his resignation effective January 20, 2021 (Inauguration Day).
